title: GM’s Strike and the Battle for Batteries
text:
Lordstown, Ohio, is already a battleground in the United Automobile Workers strike against General Motors, which entered its third week Monday. In time, it also could become emblematic of a geopolitical fight for battery supplies between the U.S. and China.

One of the most surprising features of the deal GM offered the UAW on the eve of the strike was a plan to build a battery-cell factory near its idled Lordstown assembly plant. If this happens, it would be the first investment by a Detroit auto maker in battery cells. These...
description: General Motors could help build the first unionized cell-production plant in the U.S., opening a new front in President Trump’s fight with China.
